p: H 2SO 4 is the most commonly used agent for the leaching or selective leaching of LFP, and the reaction described by Equation (6) is part of the process patented by Recupyl for LFP treatment shown in Figure 8. The patented process involves the primary crushing-screening step under inert gas. The undersize fraction is then suspended in water to liberate the active material. The resulting black mass is leached in H 2SO 4 in the presence of steel shots, which allow the recovery of residual Cu via cementation. The following steps involve the oxidation of Fe as hydroxides using H 2O 2 or O 2 and the precipitation of Li 3PO 4 with H 3PO 4 and pH adjusting agents [ 46].
